title: Barcelona in talks with Andres Iniesta to keep him at the Nou Camp passed his 36th birthday
text:
Nou Deal lined up Barcelona in talks with Andres Iniesta to keep him at the Nou Camp passed his 36th birthday 
Spanish midfielder wants a deal to be done 'as soon as possible' By Richard Forrester Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments BARCELONA want to offer club legend Andres Iniesta a new contract that will keep him at the Nou Camp until 2020. 
The midfielder’s current contract expires in the summer of 2018. EPA 3 Iniesta is set to pen a new deal until 2020 
And according to Spanish publication Mundo Deportivo , contact has been made between club and player with talks progressing well. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog . 
If the veteran does sign a new deal, it will keep him at his boyhood club passed his 36th birthday. 
The 32-year-old confirmed that he is in talks to extend his deal and admitted he wanted it done “as soon as possible.” 
Quoted in Sport, he said: “I would be delighted if there was no need to talk about this matter. 
“We’ve spoken, but I still have a year-and-a-half on my contract. For everything to be calm, the most logical thing would be for it to be done as soon as possible. Iniesta has won four Champions League titles PA:Press Association Iniesta wants a deal to be completed ‘as soon as possible’ related articles Year to forget Barcelona star Neymar suffering worst year in front of goal since he was 17 at Santos NOU-WHERE TO GO Andres Iniesta dreams of never leaving Barcelona - and insists retiring is far from his mind THERE'S A CATCH Cristiano Ronaldo hopes his son is a footballer.. as long as he's a striker and not a keeper BOOKIES BEWARE With nearly a full New Year's fixture list for punters to have a flutter on, we reveal Britain's top ten hotspots for football accumulator wins Lionel Messi's early days at Barcelona's youth academy showed precocious talent 
"I've said it a million times [that I want to stay], but the club are in control, not me. I am not the club's president." 
Iniesta has been the heartbeat to Barca's midfielder for years and took the club captaincy when Xavi left for Qatar in 2015. 
He has won eight La Liga, four Copa del Rey's and four Champions League titles during his illustrious career.
